page.title: 04THE RECLAIMED MARSH
page.content: A Freiston Shore there is some reclaimed marsh. It has been reclaimed by the Borstal Boys. On the new part they keep sheep, but on the older part there are crops. There are still concrete gun places on the bank and by the road there is a barracks for the soldiers who manned them in World War Two. The bricks are laid sideways to build it faster. There are two old hotels because a hundred years ago people came here for their holidays,when the marsh land was sand. One of them is falling down and it was called the "Marine Hotel" but it is impossible to tell. There is still a bar at the Plummer's Hotel but the ballroom wasw closed a long time ago, though there is still a bridge onto the old sea bank.
